intro: Lagenandra lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lagenandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Lagenandra lancifolia is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
